summary: The CHAMPVA Children’s Care Protection Act of 2025 aims to amend title 38 of the United States Code concerning veterans' healthcare. Specifically, it proposes to increase the maximum age for children eligible for medical care under the CHAMPVA program to their 26th birthday, regardless of marital status, with an exception for children described in section 101(4)(A)(ii). The bill's effective date is the date of enactment.
